required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Changes in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Changes in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Delivery

brief_summary.textblock: This is observational study. The investigator will measure optic nerve sheath diameter by ultrasound on the eye after cesarean section under spinal anesthesia.

primary_outcome.description: Change in Optic nerve sheathe diameter from baseline, 1,,6,24 and 48 hours after completion of surgery

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing cesarean section under spinal anesthesia

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing cesarean section under spinal anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing cesarean section under spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who did not agree to participate in the study
- Patients has ophthalmic diseases
- Patients has previous history of ophthalmic surgery.
- Patients has neurological disorders.
- Patients has history of head surgery.

reference.citation: Watanabe A, Horikoshi T, Uchida M, Ishigame K, Kinouchi H. Decreased diameter of the optic nerve sheath associated with CSF hypovolemia. AJNR Am J Neuroradiol. 2008 May;29(5):863-4. doi: 10.3174/ajnr.A1027. Epub 2008 Feb 29.
